definition: to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around

sentences.english: Airlift tipped the balance of the sieges .
sentences.chinese: 空运扭转了围攻战的战局。

sentences.english: Twists can help detoxify the internal organs and lymphatic system.
sentences.chinese: 扭转有助于提高内部器官和淋巴系统的解毒功能。

sentences.english: To reverse the " decline " in sales of Sable, and Mercury are also great to cut costs.
sentences.chinese: 扭转销售下降的紫貂，水星也主要成本削减。

sentences.english: We put forward the suitable moments for rotation of human's teeth.
sentences.chinese: 提出了人尖牙和前磨牙扭转移动时的适宜力矩。

sentences.english: Our dream is to change this bad image.
sentences.chinese: 我们的梦想是扭转这种不良印象。

sentences.english: Other very important, but more complicated, deformations are bending and torsion.
sentences.chinese: 其他非常重要，但更为复杂的是弯曲形变和扭转形变。

sentences.english: Neither have closed-door meetings or trying out rookie hurlers.
sentences.chinese: 开密室会议及派菜鸟投手上场也没有扭转颓势。

sentences.english: The twisting version will stimulate the Gall Bladder along the side of the torso.
sentences.chinese: 扭转变式会刺激沿着上身旁侧的胆经。

sentences.english: A challenge is nothing but an opportunity turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 挑战，无他，仅是一次扭转乾坤的机会。

sentences.english: But the easy money also brings a slew of unexpected problems.
sentences.chinese: 但这容易赚入的钱也带给意外问题的扭转。

sentences.english: But Mr. Obama said the current trend is reversible.
sentences.chinese: 但是奥巴马说，目前的发展趋势尚能扭转。

sentences.english: These valves will also sustain damage when excessively torqued.
sentences.chinese: 当过分扭转时，这些阀门还是会受到损伤。

sentences.english: Have him shift his lower body into a half-kneeling position, entering you from behind.
sentences.chinese: 让他扭转他的下体成半跪姿式，从后面插入。

sentences.english: This is an example of cecal volvulus .
sentences.chinese: 此图所示的为盲肠扭转。

sentences.english: Could it reverse a two-decade decline in economic and social progress?
sentences.chinese: 它是否能够扭转历时二十年的经济和社会倒退？

sentences.english: Eg. He says his friend is confident in turning the table.
sentences.chinese: 他说他的朋友很有信心扭转局面。

definition: to change/to alter/to transform
aspect/phase/situation
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
to change/to transform/shift/transformation/CL:個|个[ge4]
change of appearance/to revise one's point of view
decline (in fortune)
stagnation/at a standstill/bogged down
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to slow down/to retard
situation/state (of affairs)
by a wide margin/substantial
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to counteract/to cancel out/to offset
